column4: can anyone tell me what i would search for to find, install and add the launching icons to the dock/launcher/menu bar?
alacarte
: is that a package making things easy to use?

: think you may have misunderstood what i was looking for.. let me try to reword it. I am lookin for something to allow me to add remove and find the "applets" like sound, networks, and the like to the menu/dock/launcher
start them first, then right click on the icon and pin it
: when you open the add to panel what is the name of the objects you are adding

im assuming you are running unity, and that you start the application from the "Windows Key Menu", then on the left panel you can right click the icon for the running application and keep it on the panel
L i'm runing Ubuntu CLassic. i'm refering to when you right click on the Menu bar and the submenu allows you to add what i believe is applets, but that's what i'm tryin to figure out.
for classic i think you want to add a "launcher" applet
: not a launcher, i want to find more of the packages like trash bin, desktop switcher, network setup, email notify, and the link
i guess make sure that the gnome-applets package. its been a long time since ive used classic. sorry
: understandable. so the icons left in the dock for trash bin and desktop switcher are called applets?
yes
: is there a way to easily search for different applets that are available?
: SMP makes it a little tricky to find them easily.

it should list them all when you click on the panel. verify that you are right clicking on the panel itself and not on an applet in the panel. if your panel is full it may be hard to find a pixel that will get you the panel menu instead of an applet
: correct that does work, but is there a resource to find others that are out there? like the Package Managers does .
most of the more popular ones should be packaged up, but they dont generally come individually
: aww ok, thanks. the snypatic package manager will still find others that exist either mainstream or otherwise correct?
no you would have to compile non-packaged applets from source. I'm not sure where you can find them
: got ya now. thanks for the info.
